refnamediv.refpurpose: A GTK+ widget to display large amounts of numerical data quickly and easily.

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Properties
refsect1.synopsis: "adjustment-x" GtkAdjustment* : Read / Write / Construct "adjustment-y" GtkAdjustment* : Read / Write / Construct "enable-selection" gboolean : Read / Write / Construct "enable-zoom" gboolean : Read / Write / Construct "ruler-x" GtkDataboxRuler* : Read / Write / Construct "ruler-y" GtkDataboxRuler* : Read / Write / Construct "scale-type-x" GtkDataboxScaleType : Read / Write / Construct "scale-type-y" GtkDataboxScaleType : Read / Write / Construct

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "selection-canceled" : Run First "selection-changed" : Run First "selection-finalized" : Run First "selection-started" : Run First "zoomed" : Run First

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GtkDatabox is a widget for the GTK+ library designed to display large amounts of numerical data quickly and easily. It allows for one or more data sets of thousands of data points (X and Y coordinates) to be displayed and updated in split seconds.
It offers the ability to zoom into and out of the data, and to navigate through your data by scrolling.
In addition to rulers and a simple coordinate cross, it allows you to add one (or even more) configurable grids like on an oscilloscope.

Data may be presented as dots, lines connecting the data, or vertical bars. The widget allows you to easily transform pixel coordinates into data coordinates, thus allowing you to easily create powerful applications for data analysis.

refsect2.title: GtkDataboxPrivate
refsect2.para: A private data structure used by the GtkDatabox. It shields all internal things from developers who are just using the widget.

refsect2.title: GtkDatabox
refsect2.para: A GTK+ widget to display large amounts of numerical data quickly and easily. The numerical data is represented/displayed by GtkDataboxGraph objects, e.g. GtkDataboxPoints.
Implemented by _GtkDatabox;

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkDatabox widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_graph_add ()
refsect2.para: Adds the graph to the box. The next time the box is re-drawn, the graph will be shown.
It might be becessary to modify the total_limits in order for the graph to be displayed properly (see gtk_databox_set_total_limits()).

listitem.simpara: A graph, e.g. a GtkDataboxPoints or a GtkDataboxGrid object

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_graph_remove ()
refsect2.para: Removes the graph from the box once. The next time the box is re-drawn, the graph will not be shown (unless it was added more than once).

listitem.simpara: A graph, e.g. a GtkDataboxPoints or a GtkDataboxGrid object

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_graph_remove_all ()
refsect2.para: Removes all graphs from the box. The next time the box is re-drawn, no graphs will be shown.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_auto_rescale ()
refsect2.para: This function is similar to gtk_databox_set_total_limits(). It sets the total limits to match the data extrema (see gtk_databox_calculate_extrema()). If you do not like data pixels exactly at the widget's border, you can add modify the limits using the border parameter: The limits are extended by border*(max-min) if max!=min. If max==min, they are extended by border*max (otherwise the data could not be scaled to the pixel realm).
After calling this function, x values grow from left to right, y values grow from bottom to top.

listitem.simpara: Relative border width (e.g. 0.1 means that the border on each side is 10% of the data area).
0 on success, -1 if box is no GtkDatabox widget, -2 if no datasets are available

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_calculate_extrema ()
refsect2.programlisting: gint gtk_databox_calculate_extrema (GtkDatabox *box, gfloat *min_x, gfloat *max_x, gfloat *min_y, gfloat *max_y);
refsect2.para: Determines the minimum and maximum x and y values of all GtkDataboxGraph objects which have been added to the GtkDatabox widget via gtk_databox_graph_add().

listitem.simpara: Will be filled with the lowest x value of all datasets
Will be filled with the highest x value of all datasets
Will be filled with the lowest y value of all datasets
Will be filled with the highest y value of all datasets
0 on success, -1 if box is no GtkDatabox widget, -2 if no datasets are available

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_total_limits ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_databox_set_total_limits (GtkDatabox *box, gfloat left, gfloat right, gfloat top, gfloat bottom);
refsect2.para: This function is used to set the limits of the total display area of box. This function can be used to invert the orientation of the displayed graphs, e.g. top=-1000 and bottom=0.
Side effect: The box also internally calls gtk_databox_set_visible_limits() with the same values.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_visible_limits ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_databox_set_visible_limits (GtkDatabox *box, gfloat left, gfloat right, gfloat top, gfloat bottom);
refsect2.para: This function is used to set the limits of the visible display area of box. The visible display area can be section of the total area, i.e. the box zooms in, showing only a part of the complete picture.
The orientation of the values have to be the same as in gtk_databox_set_total_limits() and the visible limits have to be within the total limits. The values will not be used otherwise.
Side effect: The box emits "zoomed".

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_total_limits ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_databox_get_total_limits (GtkDatabox *box, gfloat *left, gfloat *right, gfloat *top, gfloat *bottom);
refsect2.para: Gives the total limits (as set by gtk_databox_auto_rescale() or gtk_databox_set_total_limits()).

listitem.simpara: Space for total left value or NULL
Space for total right value or NULL
Space for total top value or NULL
Space for total bottom value or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_visible_limits ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_databox_get_visible_limits (GtkDatabox *box, gfloat *left, gfloat *right, gfloat *top, gfloat *bottom);
refsect2.para: Gives the current visible limits. These differ from those given by gtk_databox_get_total_limits() if you zoomed into the data for instance by gtk_databox_zoom_to_selection() or gtk_databox_set_visible_limits() (these values can be changed by scrolling, of course).

listitem.simpara: Space for visible left value or NULL
Space for visible right value or NULL
Space for visible top value or NULL
Space for visible bottom value or NULL

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_adjustment_x ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "adjustment-x" property. Normally, it should not be required to use this function, see property documentation.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_adjustment_y ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "adjustment-y" property. Normally, it should not be required to use this function, see property documentation.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_adjustment_x ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "adjustment-x" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_adjustment_y ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "adjustment-y" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_ruler_x ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "ruler-x" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_ruler_y ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "ruler-y" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_ruler_x ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "ruler-x" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_ruler_y ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "ruler-y" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_scale_type_x ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "scale-type-x" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_scale_type_y ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "scale-type-y" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_scale_type_x ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "scale-type-x" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_scale_type_y ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "scale-type-y" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_enable_selection ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "enable-selection" property.

listitem.simpara: Whether selection via mouse is enabled or not.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_set_enable_zoom ()
refsect2.para: Setter function for the "enable-zoom" property.

listitem.simpara: Whether zoom via mouse is enabled or not.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_enable_selection ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "enable-selection" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_enable_zoom ()
refsect2.para: Getter function for the "enable-zoom" property.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_zoom_to_selection ()
refsect2.para: This is equivalent to left-clicking into the selected area.
This function works, if the attribute enable-zoom is set to TRUE. Calling the function then zooms to the area selected with the mouse.
Side effect: The box emits "zoomed".

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_zoom_out ()
refsect2.para: This is equivalent to right-clicking into the box.

This function works, if the attribute enable-zoom is set to TRUE. Calling the function then zooms out by a factor of 2 in both dimensions (the maximum is defined by the total limits, see gtk_databox_set_total_limits()).
Side effect: The box emits "zoomed".

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_zoom_home ()
refsect2.para: This is equivalent to shift right-clicking into the box.
This function works, if the attribute enable-zoom is set to TRUE. It is equivalent to calling the gtk_databox_set_visible_limits() with the total limits.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_value_to_pixel_x ()
refsect2.para: Calculates the horizontal pixel coordinate which represents the x value. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the box which is equivalent to (0,0).

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_value_to_pixel_y ()
refsect2.para: Calculates the vertical pixel coordinate which represents the y value. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the box which is equivalent to (0,0).

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_pixel_to_value_x ()
refsect2.para: Calculates the x value which is represented by the horizontal pixel coordinate. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the box which is equivalent to (0,0).

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_pixel_to_value_y ()
refsect2.para: Calculates the y value which is represented by the vertical pixel coordinate. Pixel coordinates are relative to the top-left corner of the box which is equivalent to (0,0).

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_values_to_pixels ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_databox_values_to_pixels (GtkDatabox *box, guint len, const gfloat *values_x, const gfloat *values_y, GdkPoint *pixels);
refsect2.para: Calculates the pixel equivalents of the given X/Y values and stores them in the pixels array.

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_create_box_with_scrollbars_and_rulers ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gtk_databox_create_box_with_scrollbars_and_rulers (GtkWidget **p_box, GtkWidget **p_table, gboolean scrollbar_x, gboolean scrollbar_y, gboolean ruler_x, gboolean ruler_y);
refsect2.para: This is a convenience function which creates a GtkDatabox widget in a GtkTable widget optionally accompanied by scrollbars and rulers. You only have to fill in the data (gtk_databox_graph_add()) and adjust the limits (gtk_databox_set_total_limits() or gtk_databox_auto_rescale()).
see_also: gtk_databox_new(), gtk_databox_set_adjustment_x(), gtk_databox_set_adjustment_y(), gtk_databox_set_ruler_x(), gtk_databox_set_ruler_y()

listitem.simpara: Will contain a pointer to a GtkDatabox widget
Will contain a pointer to a GtkTable widget
Whether to attach a horizontal scrollbar
Whether to attach a vertical scrollbar
Whether to attach a horizontal ruler
Whether to attach a vertical ruler

refsect2.title: gtk_databox_get_backing_pixmap ()
refsect2.para: This function returns the pixmap which is used by box and its GtkDataboxGraph objects for drawing operations before copying the result to the screen.
The function is typically called by the GtkDataboxGraph objects.

refsect2.title: The "adjustment-x" property
refsect2.para: GtkAdjustment for horizontal scrolling.

refsect2.title: The "adjustment-y" property
refsect2.para: GtkAdjustment for vertical scrolling.

refsect2.title: The "enable-selection" property
refsect2.para: Defines whether the user can select rectangular areas with the mouse (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "enable-zoom" property
refsect2.para: Defines whether the user can use the mouse to zoom in or out (TRUE) or not (FALSE).
Default value: TRUE

refsect2.title: The "ruler-x" property
refsect2.para: A horizontal GtkDataboxRuler or NULL.

refsect2.title: The "ruler-y" property
refsect2.para: A vertical GtkDataboxRuler or NULL.

refsect2.title: The "scale-type-x" property
refsect2.para: Horizontal scale type (linear or logarithmic).
Default value: GTK_DATABOX_SCALE_LINEAR

refsect2.title: The "scale-type-y" property
refsect2.para: Vertical scale type (linear or logarithmic).
Default value: GTK_DATABOX_SCALE_LINEAR

refsect1.title: Signal Details
refsect1.refsect2:
The "selection-canceled" signal GtkDatabox::selection-canceledvoid user_function (GtkDatabox *box, gpointer user_data) : Run First
This signal is emitted after a right click outside a selection rectangle.
@: box : The GtkDatabox widget which zoomed in or out.
user_data : user data set when the signal handler was connected.

The "selection-changed" signal GtkDatabox::selection-changedvoid user_function (GtkDatabox *box, gpointer selection_values, gpointer user_data) : Run First
This signal is emitted when the mouse is moved with the left button pressed (and the "enable-selection" property is set). The corners of the selection rectangle are stored in selection_values.
@: @: box : The GtkDatabox widget in which the selection was changed.
selection_values : The corners of the selection rectangle.
user_data : user data set when the signal handler was connected.

The "selection-finalized" signal GtkDatabox::selection-finalizedvoid user_function (GtkDatabox *box, gpointer selection_values, gpointer user_data) : Run First
This signal is emitted when the left mouse button is released after a selection was started before.
see_also: "selection-changed"
@: @: box : The GtkDatabox widget in which the selection has been stopped.
selection_values : The corners of the selection rectangle.
user_data : user data set when the signal handler was connected.

The "selection-started" signal GtkDatabox::selection-startedvoid user_function (GtkDatabox *box, gpointer selection_values, gpointer user_data) : Run First
This signal is emitted when the mouse is firstmoved with the left button pressed after the mouse-down (and the "enable-selection" property is set). The corners of the selection rectangle are stored in selection_values.
see_also: "selection-changed"
@: @: box : The GtkDatabox widget in which the selection has been started.
selection_values : The corners of the selection rectangle.
user_data : user data set when the signal handler was connected.

The "zoomed" signal GtkDatabox::zoomedvoid user_function (GtkDatabox *box, gpointer user_data) : Run First
This signal is emitted each time the zoom of the widget is changed, see for example gtk_databox_zoom_to_selection(), gtk_databox_set_visible_limits().
@: box : The GtkDatabox widget which zoomed in or out.
user_data : user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refentry.refsect1: See Also GtkDataboxGraph, GtkDataboxPoints, GtkDataboxLines, GtkDataboxMarkers, GtkDataboxGrid
